column4: anyone who has some crap looking fonts and font sizes in firefox give this a try: sudo apt-get install msttcorefonts ... who knows why it's not done by default

when I go to add applications and search for apt, the package apt-listchanges doesn't show up, but from a console I can do sudo apt-get install apt-listchanges and it is downloaded and installed.  Why doesn't apt-listchanges show up in "add applications"
becuse if all the apps available were there, you would have 17 000 choices :)
everything shows in synaptic package manager though
do you know what the criteria is for allowing packages to show up there?  or where I can find it?
no, sorry - but if you want to browse, just use the more advanced synaptic
I believe there's an "advvnced" button in breezy that starts synaptic anyway
ok  thanks.  yeah I found it
supported packages
i.e. ones in the "main" repo
the others are "community supported"
ok thanks
once a new version is released, only bug fixes and security updates
if you want constant new stuff, you would track the new development version
is that ubuntu's version of debian unstable?
not exactly, no
it's the development version which would release each 6 months
oh I see... do you use it?  is its stability comparable to that of debian unstable?
ubuntu uses a different model from debian's
no, I'm still using the older version ;) But breezy is "stable"
the new dev version will be "dapper"
have they started dapper yet
I don't think so - it's only a few days since breezy was released
